summary: The document is a classified communication pertaining to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act, focusing on clandestine activities, particularly those related to anti-Castro movements in Cuba. It outlines specific communication codes, operational procedures for arms and equipment delivery, and identifies key individuals involved in these activities. The text also recounts incidents of arrests and escapes by opponents of the Castro regime, highlighting the roles of militia and G-2 agents in Cuba.
key_findings: Specific communication codes are detailed, including instructions on their use.
Operational procedures for the delivery of arms and equipment in Cuba are outlined.
Individuals involved in anti-Castro activities are identified, along with their roles and affiliations.
Accounts of arrests and escapes by individuals opposing the Castro regime are provided.
The involvement of militia and G-2 agents in specific Cuban locations is noted.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
